definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: He vacillates from agile, amiable, and arch to repetitive and awkward.
sentences.chinese: 他搖擺不定的敏捷，和藹可親，並拱重複和尷尬。

sentences.english: Doubts about this eternal truth come because of the wavering Mind.
sentences.chinese: 對此永恆真理會產生懷疑是因爲心念搖擺不定。

sentences.english: The staggering totals indicate why McGrady needed to get to the hoop.
sentences.chinese: 搖擺不定的數據表明了爲什麼麥迪需要更靠近籃圈。

sentences.english: Abdominal tenderness is noted, and pelvic examination reveals cervical motion tenderness.
sentences.chinese: 腹部壓痛明顯，盆腔檢查提示宮頸搖擺痛。

sentences.english: Phenomenon of this kind of pendulous still fails to get ameliorative in subsequently time.
sentences.chinese: 這種搖擺的現象在隨後的時間裏仍未能得到改善。

sentences.english: Kind of makes you want to move, and it's just fun.
sentences.chinese: 會讓你想不停地搖擺，很有趣。

sentences.english: And the new animal was pleased to be with Adam and it wagged its tail.
sentences.chinese: 而且新的動物很高興與亞當，而且它搖擺了它的尾部。

sentences.english: And his stance in nuclear negotiations frequently appears contradictory and confounding.
sentences.chinese: 還有他在覈問題的談判立場經常自相矛盾，左右搖擺。

sentences.english: I held Georgia close. We swayed to the music and slowly turned.
sentences.chinese: 我把喬治婭抱緊，我們隨音樂搖擺，慢慢旋轉。

sentences.english: Mr Samaras, as opposition leader, has taken an equivocal position.
sentences.chinese: 作爲反對派領袖，薩馬拉斯的立場搖擺不定。

sentences.english: In Nebraska they swing by the hospital and abrogate all responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 在內布拉斯加是和醫院一起搖擺，取消了所有的責任。

sentences.english: He didn't have a care in the world as he waddled down the street.
sentences.chinese: 他搖搖擺擺走過大街的樣子好像對這個世界毫無牽掛。

sentences.english: My emotions continued to seesaw between pleasure and embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 我的心情也依然在高興與不自在之間搖擺不定。

sentences.english: That wiggled and wriggled and jiggled inside her.
sentences.chinese: 蜘蛛在她肚裏快速扭動搖擺。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
